div.p: So there’s like 3 parts of being an architect, so the first part is your Part One and you’ve got to study for 3 years so I’ve already done that;
the first year never counts it’s just to sort of get into the swing of things, second year is sort of you know you learn to do larger buildings
so like schools or offices or something along those lines, the third one is sort of you’re out to make your own work as such.
So once you’ve got your degree you get your ARB Part One and usually kids tend to take a year out and that’s where you’re supposed to do
professional development so that’s when you work in a practice or you do architectural-related things for a year.
It’s not necessary to do it immediately after your degree you can go straight on to Part Two which is what I’m doing now which is two more years
of study and then the third part is your exam and you’ve got to be able to know every Building Reg and how the construction industry works
essentially and then once you’ve done that you’re fully qualified and you could set up your own studio or you can work for somebody else
as a fully qualified architect. It’s just freedom to do whatever you want as long as you can back it up you can do anything whatsoever
it’s a very imaginative course and that’s what I like about working in architecture there’s no wrong answer.
